## Routing Logic

Cuando el usuario haga una peticiÃ³n, sigue esta lÃ³gica:

```
IF peticiÃ³n menciona "commit" OR "git" OR "cambios" OR "genera commit"
   â†’ USE commit-generator SKILL (auto-ejecuta commits)
   â†’ ALSO USE get_changed_files tool

IF peticiÃ³n menciona "reorganiza" OR "rebase" OR "limpia historial"
   â†’ USE commit-reorganizer SKILL
   â†’ Interactive workflow con confirmaciones

IF peticiÃ³n menciona "issue" OR "crear issue" OR "nueva tarea"
   â†’ USE issue-generator SKILL
   â†’ Interactive: pregunta por contexto

IF peticiÃ³n menciona "jira" OR "ticket" OR "documentar ticket"
   â†’ USE jira-readme.prompt.md
   â†’ ALSO USE create_file para guardar resultado

IF peticiÃ³n menciona "review" OR "revisar" OR "cÃ³digo"
   â†’ USE code-review-performance-security.prompt.md
   â†’ Check OWASP, performance, security

   â†’ USE analyze-design-patterns.prompt.md

   â†’ USE implement-strategy-pattern.prompt.md

   â†’ USE chain-of-responsibility-validation.prompt.md

   â†’ USE decorator-pattern-runtime.prompt.md

   â†’ USE replace-if-else-polymorphism.prompt.md

   â†’ USE code-review-performance-security.prompt.md

   â†’ USE reactive-testing-complete.prompt.md

   â†’ USE streams-pipeline-filter-map-reduce.prompt.md

   â†’ USE openapi-generator SKILL
   â†’ ALSO USE create_file para generar YAML
```

## Tool Usage Strategy

```
ALWAYS START WITH:
1. Entender la peticiÃ³n del usuario
2. Mostrar quÃ© prompt/skill voy a usar
3. Explorar el cÃ³digo con tools si es necesario

FOR CODE ANALYSIS:
1. list_dir â†’ Entender estructura
2. file_search â†’ Encontrar archivos relevantes
3. grep_search â†’ Buscar patrones especÃ­ficos
4. read_file â†’ Leer cÃ³digo en detalle
5. list_code_usages â†’ Ver dependencias

FOR CODE CHANGES:
1. read_file â†’ Leer cÃ³digo actual
2. replace_string_in_file â†’ Hacer cambios
3. get_errors â†’ Verificar errores
4. runTests â†’ Ejecutar tests

FOR COMMITS:
1. get_changed_files â†’ Ver quÃ© cambiÃ³
2. run_in_terminal: git diff --stat â†’ Ver estadÃ­sticas
3. Generar mensaje siguiendo conventional commits
```
